name: Giolli Hotel

reviews.text: It took us at least an hour of driving around the historic area to find the hotel. The location is easy to find but we made some wrong turns and got stuck on some narrow one-way streets. We called the gentleman at the front desk of Hotel Giolli and he was very patient and helpful. I stayed here with my mother, aunt and cousin for 4 nights. My mother and I shared room 306 which had two twin beds. The beds were comfortable, the air conditioning worked well and the bathroom was clean. There was a full tub with a shower head, but, as with most 3 stars in Italy, no shower curtain. Our safe had dead batteries when we arrived but they were replaced before we returned from dinner that night. I was glad that it fit my 13" laptop. The internet access in the lobby came and went but was free. The breakfast was standard Italian light breakfast with pastries, yogurt, fruit, cappuccino and hard boiled eggs. We were only a few minutes walk to the Repubblica metro stop and just a little farther to the main terminal station. We found the metro very easy to use and affordable. Just before you get to the Repubblica stop walking from the hotel there is a news stand that sells metro and bus tickets. The walk to Trevi fountain was about 10 minutes. The evening concierge recommended a restaurant two blocks away and gave us a coupon for it. The food was great and the service even better. We ate here 2 nights. The building feels nice and secure. There are security guards in a booth as you head up the stairs and he exterior door is closed after 10pm. There is a call button and they buzz you in.
reviews.title: Great place for a great price!
Carlo! Carlo! Carlo!
reviews.text: Me and my two girlfriends spent 4 nights at Hotel Giolli. The location was fantastic! One day we literally didn't realize that we walked from our hotel to the Vatican to the Spanish steps.... We walked to the Colliseum at night. The only place we didn't walk to were the Castello Romano Outlets (45 min drive) and Naples (1 hour train ride). Now, to get to the point, CARLO!!!!!!!!!!!!! Carlo is the greatest asset that any tourist can have. Every recommendation that he made was absolute perfecto! He was kind, generous with information, and always greeted us with a smile. While staying in Sorrento and Madrid, my girlfriends and I stayed at Hilton Hotels, and I must say that I missed Carlo when we were in those other hotels. The hotel was quaint and the room for 3 was big enough for 3 women to share a bathroom without killing each other :) Thank you Carlo for your hospitality! When we visit Rome again, we know where to stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 7 days - the rooms are great - very big - as well as the bathrooms. Best location - walking distance to most of the sites. A 5 minute walk to the train station and metro. Good restaurants close as well as reasonable shopping.
reviews.title: Great place and excellent location!

reviews.text: The staff was very helpful - great suggestions for the restaurants - good work Carlos!!. The price is not cheap - we were able to negotiate our rate down a bit - it averaged out to 150 per night - considering the location and the quality of the place - well worth it.
reviews.title: Saving Grace was Carlo - otherwise wouldn't recommend

reviews.text: Wifi available and included in price of room as well as breakfast. Wifi only available in breakfast room. Breakfast was ok -- basic cold hard boiled eggs and fresh pastries. Coffee not so great though.
reviews.title: Decent place but unfriendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room w/o a view, but comfortable and clean. Great staff, friendly and helpful, and a superb breakfast room. Decent cold-cut breakfast with five star capuccino, if you request. Walk out the door and you are in full-tilt Roman mode. Metro is a few blocks away, and the number sixty-four famous sites bus runs right in front. It made for a great stay in a great city. Wish we could stay in a similar one in NYC for the same price.
reviews.title: Solid value hotel in a great Rome location

reviews.text: Giolli is wonderfully kept and employs some great people. It has a perfect location - 7 minutes to vittorio emanuele and the fori imperiali, another 10 to trevi fountain or the quirinale and a bus station which serves termini in 5 minutes. plus, via nazionale is extremely safe even at small hours
reviews.title: I'll be back, of course :)

reviews.text: The service is very good, and staff are friendly and accommodating, not to say they have a good sense of humor. The rooms vary in size from regular to very spacious, but never cramped. Breakfast is a bit unimaginative though. The building is an old building, large and luminous, perfectly preserved and carefully adapted to modern comforts
reviews.title: great hotel, excellent location

reviews.text: overall, it's very good and I'll be back next spring
reviews.title: Perfect Location

reviews.text: room was clean, bathroom was large -had a bathtub with a shower head as well!!! great location, walking distance to so much... fabulous shopping outside the door, as well as great restaurants on the side streets surrounding the hotel. would stay there again for sure.
reviews.title: overrated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is realy overrated. They have only few rooms which photos you could see on official site. All others are not so good furnitured and decorated, they are very simple and dark, we had a bad luck to have one of them. The brekfast was terrible. Wi-Fi was realy free, but it worked normally only in lobby. The staff was normal, but not good. The only merit of this hotel is location.
reviews.title: It was not what I had expected

reviews.text: I enjoyed my stay at Giolli Hotel in Rome. It is perfectly located in the center of the city, walking distance from "Piazza Venezia" and from Rome Termini Train Station, which makes it easy to reach, and from all other major touristic attractions. The staff was really friendly and helpful, which is something that contribute to a nice vacation. I would recommend Giolli Hotel for all of you planning to go to Rome.
reviews.title: A place to stay ay, enjoy and come back to.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of the hotel is comfortable in the center, near to busses and metro. The first night we had a room to the street with traffic, but we could change it into a more calm room. They have a fine breakfast whith youghurt and so on. It´s important to eat well before going on sight-seeing.
reviews.title: A very nice place to stay, Rome is noicy, but this hotel is quite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel is located in the heart of the city of Rome, walking distance to major attractions, it really represents a perfect starting point for exploring the historic center (Piazza Venezia, Colosseo, Fori Romani, Fontana di Trevi, Piazza di Spagna, Piazza Navona, famous Shopping Streets etc.). The room was very comfortable and clean. The staff was extremely friendly, polite and helpful: always able to answer questions and resolve any issues. Good breakfast buffet including Italian pastries. We definitely recommend this hotel to everyone and we are looking forward to coming back again!
reviews.title: Great Hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 4 nights in the beginning of November 2009 and we were very satisfied. Nice hotel, situated in the 3 first floors of a mansion house with friendly staff, basic/plain breakfast, a comfortable double room, Wi-Fi, small LCD TV and “paper thin walls” (that caused no serious problems though).
reviews.title: Good work Giolli!
This hotel is superb. Location and...
reviews.text: This hotel is superb. Location and facilities are excellent. Staff are friendly and helpful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was staying at a 4 star before this hotel and this was infinately. Cannot recommend this highly enough. Will stay here again and have told all my friends.
reviews.title: Worth the money.. and free Wifi!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Giolli Hotel in the beginning of Nov 09 and although the hotel doesn't have all the bells and whistles we have at hotels in the US, it has everything you truley need for a pleasant stay and the location is FANTASTIC! There is something to be said for an excellent location in Rome when you are walking all day long... and you get this at a very resonable price. We are planning our next visit to Rome and will probrably stay at this location again but will upgrade to a luxury room. I also must say that Carlo is a huge asset to the staff and can recommend wonderful places to eat! Thanks Carlos for making my trip wonderful! Ciao..
reviews.title: Average

reviews.text: Stayed at the Giolli for a week in July last year, Reception, lounge and Bar are very presentable, nice furnishings ect, The guy on reception was quite friendly and checked us in without any problems, The room itself wasnt too bad but looked nothing like the ones on the website, also the room was a bit dark, air con diddnt work to well either and with the heat of July it wasnt great, but it was clean and housekeeping left clean towels everyday , breakfast was what you would expect in rome, coffee and pastries mainly,
reviews.title: Memorable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I wouldnt say this hotel is luxury but is in a good location ( plenty of restaurants around and within walking distance to major attractions) and clean and basic.
reviews.title: Excellent place to stay

description: Situated in the centre of Rome, the Hotel Giolli in Rome enjoys a prime and executive privileged position on the prestigious Via Nazionale, in the heart of the historical and commercial area.This late nineteenth century mansion house is situated very close to the Quirinale palace and opposite the Exhibition Hall.With the hotel Giolli in Rome as a comfortable and convenient base, you can visit all of Rome's major attractions and most recognised landmarks, allowing you to experience the city's awe-inspiring beauty, history and culture.Momuments, shops, restaurants and cafes are all within the immediate vicinity.Tastefully furnished and well equipped rooms, the Hotel Giolli in Rome offers authentic marble bathrooms, complete with hair dryer.Room amenities include, mini bar, satellite color TV, direct dial telephone, in room safe, key card access, wifi and smoke alarms.Hotel is completely air conditioned with sound proofed windows, doors and an advanced alarm system assuring total securtiy.The area has a rich selection of restaurants and shops, and is also home to several banks and ministries.
